result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed with Prejudice
*Reason:  Defendant has complied with all requirements of the VIP

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J Pratt

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Steven J Pratt
Current: 316 6th Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 07-24-2020)
Prior: 261 Shannon Court 2, Plover, WI 54467

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Dismiss /s/ RJS 05/02/17  - Dismissed with Prejudice; Reason:  Defendant has complied with all requirements of the VIP
from VIP Program Director, Mike Champion, dated 02/08/17 in re:  request to successfully discharge defendant from VIP program effective immediately

Defendant Steven J Pratt in court with attorney Eric Sheets. ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Count 1: VIP agreement 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to withhold entering Judgment of Conviction this date. 
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

BY THE COURT:***VIP***
9 months
25 hrs Community Service
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in other community based services at the descretion of the VIP Agent.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven J Pratt in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Authorization for Attorney to Appear and Act

No knowing or intentional contact with Morgan Kelly and Derek Smith or their residences.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Defendant Steven J Pratt in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:48 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court will adjourn to allow for the defendant to seek counsel. 

Atty Constable recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant indicates he does not know the no contact requests.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
